CatDescriptText: Mr. Royal H. Boyer Jr., 1834 Third Avenue, Beaver Falls, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should a woman, who has passed the age of 45, marry for the first time?" answer reads: "I don't see anything wrong with it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Royal H. Boyer Jr., wearing dark hat with braided band, moustache, dark scarf, plaid shirt, and light colored double breasted coat, standing with hands in pockets in front of marble wall between store windows, one on right with mannequin wearing bridal veil and gown
